articles.title: How does COVID-19 compare with other deadly viruses? - The South African
articles.description: The global death toll from COVID-19 passed three million on Saturday 17 April, with the pandemic already having killed more people than most other viral epidemics of the 20th and 21st centuries.
articles.content:
But there have been notable exceptions. The post-World War One Spanish Flu wiped out 50 million people, according to some estimates. And over the decades HIV/Aids has killed 33 million.
